title: A Framework for Early Literacy Development with Parents: Opportunities, Recognition, Interaction and Models.
abstractText:
The ORIM framework is the central and original concept to the REAL Project family literacy programme (Nutbrown, Hannon and Morgan 2005), and to 'Making it REAL' a family literacy project led by the National Children's Bureau, in partnership with the School of Education, University of Sheffield. 

The project builds this latest collaboration with the NCB, and Local Authorities.The ORIM framework is key to this Knowledge Exchange project, designed to engage a wider group of early childhood education practitioners. The question which informs this proposal is: 'How can practitioners in early years settings make meaningful use of the ORIM framework to support their work with parents to promote early literacy development'? This question will be addressed through two national conferences and three residential working groups of practitioners who will adapt  and use of the ORIM framework into their current family literacy practices (and where practitioners wish to, to new curriculum areas) and for use with families and a range of practitioners nation-wide. Following the workshops, materials will be collated and uploaded on to the REALonline website and practitioners will share their experiences and new developments of working with the ORIM framework at an end of project conference.

Nutbrown, C. Hannon, P. and Morgan, A. (2005) Early literacy work with families: policy, practice and research London: Sage
